DataElement.preferredName: Components of Primary Care Instrument 48 How Long Been a Patient of This Doctor Year Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated indication of how many years they have been a patient of this doctor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Components of Primary Care Instrument How Long Been a Patient of This Doctor Year Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to measure key aspects of the delivery of primary care from the perspective of patients visiting their family physician, and to report the association of these aspects with patient satisfaction._A question about how long an individual has been a patient of a specific doctor._A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._The period of time during which something continues.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How many years have you been
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many years have you been a patient of this doctor?

DataElement.origin: CPCI: Components of Primary Care Instrument; Flocke et al., Journal of Family Practice, July 1997
